text: was a Sengoku period Japanese castle in Ehime Prefecture, Japan. The site was designated a National Historic Site. ==History== Kagomori Castle was built by Watanabe clan. It is said that Tōdō Takatora relocated Tenshu tower from the castle to his Imabari Castle. The castle was listed as one of the Continued Top 100 Japanese Castles in 2017. The castle is now only ruins, with some stone walls, moats and earthworks but a gate has been reconstructed. ==See also== *List of Historic Sites of Japan (Ehime) ==References== Category:Castles in Ehime Prefecture Category:Historic Sites of Japan Category:Former castles in Japan Category:Ruined castles in Japan
title: Kagomori Castle
